Life Solina - The Royal Archives of Aden:
Haughty Emperor Baium openly opposed Einhasad, he desired to free themselves from the intervention of the gods and to become a god. In order to gain eternal life and immortality, he began to build a huge tower, defying the goddess Einhasad. Immensely cruel was the fate of the emperor, who had dared to oppose the all-powerful goddess.
Puffed up Baium was cursed Einhasad and other gods and imprisoned in a tower erected by himself. It turned into a world unknown creature who is neither a man nor an evil spirit, or God. He found no eternal life, and immortality, unhappy now can not dispose of any of his life or his death. Later, people called this bath the Tower of Insolence. It is a good example showing how unreasonable is the resistance caused by the arrogance of man to the great gods.
